text: Daniel Hamilton Richards (February 12, 1808 - February 6, 1877) was an American politician and newspaper editor. Born in Burlington, New York, Richards moved to Milwaukee, Michigan Territory in 1835. In 1836, he started a newspaper The Advertiser. Richards was a Democrat and served in the Wisconsin State Assembly in 1868, 1870, 1871, 1874, and 1875. Richards died in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.'Collections of the State Historical Society of Wisconsin,' vol. 8, Madison, Wisconsin: 1879, pg. 456'Wisconsin Blue Book 1877,' Biographical Sketch of Daniel Hamilton Richards, pg. 329 ==Notes== Category:1808 births Category:1877 deaths Category:People from Burlington, New York Category:Politicians from Milwaukee Category:Editors of Wisconsin newspapers Category:Wisconsin Democrats Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:19th-century American journalists Category:American male journalists Category:19th-century American male writers Category:19th- century American politicians
title: Daniel H. Richards
